meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm diving into the world of PixelJunk Monsters, where cute cartoon creatures meet serious tower defense strategy. It's like having a sugar high from eating too many gummy bears - you know it's gonna be fun, but also kinda silly.

First off, let me just say that these critics are a bunch of party poopers (just kidding, I love 'em!). They're all about the stats and the scores, but what really matters is how much fun you have playing. And trust me, you'll have plenty!

Gaming Age says it's deceivingly simple at first, but don't be fooled - there's more to mastering each level than meets the eye (or should I say, meets the pixel?). That's true! As you progress, things get a whole lot trickier. But hey, that just makes it more exciting!

Play Magazine raves about the HD visuals, saying they're so sharp and appealing in high-def. And yeah, the game does look stunning! But let's be real - who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned pixel art style? It's like having a retro party in your computer!

Cheat Code Central gives it an 88, praising its "complete-feeling RTS-based gameplay." Yeah, it's got that going for it! And even though the game might be short (only 8-9 hours or so), it's packed with fun. That's what counts, right?

Hardcore Gamer says it's all about allocating your resources wisely as those pesky monsters advance. You gotta juggle gold, gems, firepower, and time like a master juggler! It's addictive, to say the least.

Gameplayer agrees - this game is simple in theory, but so engrossing in practice. The hand-drawn graphics are adorable, and you can easily lose hours in this world. Who knew managing your economy and overlapping fields of fire could be so much fun?

DailyGame says it takes a lot of patience to battle those PixelJunk Monsters. And yeah, you do need some serious zen-like vibes going on. But hey, that's all part of the fun! It's like having a digital meditation session - except with explosions and chaos.

Lastly, PTGamers gives it 70, saying it's "initially" fun (wink, wink). Okay, so maybe they're not entirely convinced, but I think even they had a blast playing it! And hey, that's what matters most!

So there you have it - PixelJunk Monsters in all its pixelated glory. It may not be for everyone, but if you enjoy tower defense games or just want to have some silly fun, give it a go!
